trans-unit.source: Create Index
trans-unit.target: Create Index

trans-unit.source: Create Index (Azure Search Service REST API)
trans-unit.target: Create Index (Azure Search Service REST API)

trans-unit.source: An index is the primary means of organizing and searching documents in Azure Search, similar to how a table organizes records in a database.
trans-unit.target: An index is the primary means of organizing and searching documents in Azure Search, similar to how a table organizes records in a database.

trans-unit.source: Each index has a collection of documents that all conform to the index schema (field names, data types, and properties), but indexes also specify additional constructs (suggesters, scoring profiles, and CORS configuration) that define other search behaviors.
trans-unit.target: Each index has a collection of documents that all conform to the index schema (field names, data types, and properties), but indexes also specify additional constructs (suggesters, scoring profiles, and CORS configuration) that define other search behaviors.

trans-unit.source: You can create a new index within an Azure Search service using an HTTP POST or PUT request.
trans-unit.target: You can create a new index within an Azure Search service using an HTTP POST or PUT request.

trans-unit.source: The body of the request is a JSON schema that specifies the index and configuration information.
trans-unit.target: The body of the request is a JSON schema that specifies the index and configuration information.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use PUT and specify the index name on the URI.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use PUT and specify the index name on the URI.

trans-unit.source: If the index does not exist, it will be created.
trans-unit.target: If the index does not exist, it will be created.

trans-unit.source: Creating an index establishes the schema and metadata.
trans-unit.target: Creating an index establishes the schema and metadata.

trans-unit.source: Populating the index is a separate operation.
trans-unit.target: Populating the index is a separate operation.

trans-unit.source: For this step, you can use an indexer (see <link xlink:href="99bd2afa-3413-424c-a54a-58c8bb12bdbe" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Indexer operations (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>, available for supported data sources) or an <link xlink:href="75503cda-fbc5-4e70-ac14-35fdedd0c001" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add, Update or Delete Documents (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: For this step, you can use an indexer (see <link xlink:href="99bd2afa-3413-424c-a54a-58c8bb12bdbe" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Indexer operations (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>, available for supported data sources) or an <link xlink:href="75503cda-fbc5-4e70-ac14-35fdedd0c001" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add, Update or Delete Documents (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: The inverted index is generated when the documents are posted.
trans-unit.target: The inverted index is generated when the documents are posted.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of indexes that you can create varies by pricing tier.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of indexes that you can create varies by pricing tier.

trans-unit.source: The free service allows up to 3 indexes.
trans-unit.target: The free service allows up to 3 indexes.

trans-unit.source: Standard service allows 50 indexes per Search service.
trans-unit.target: Standard service allows 50 indexes per Search service.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="a8b1e21e-7703-4718-8e29-c8825354b3ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Limits and constraints (Azure Search API)</link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="a8b1e21e-7703-4718-8e29-c8825354b3ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Limits and constraints (Azure Search API)</link> for details.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is required for all service requests.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is required for all service requests.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Create Index</languageKeyword> request can be constructed using either a POST or PUT method.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Create Index</languageKeyword> request can be constructed using either a POST or PUT method.

trans-unit.source: When using POST, provide an index name in the request body along with the index schema definition.
trans-unit.target: When using POST, provide an index name in the request body along with the index schema definition.

trans-unit.source: With PUT, the index name is part of the URL.
trans-unit.target: With PUT, the index name is part of the URL.

trans-unit.source: If the index doesn't exist, it is created.
trans-unit.target: If the index doesn't exist, it is created.

trans-unit.source: If it already exists, it is updated to the new definition.
trans-unit.target: If it already exists, it is updated to the new definition.

trans-unit.source: Notice that you can only POST or PUT one index at a time.
trans-unit.target: Notice that you can only POST or PUT one index at a time.

trans-unit.source: The index name must be lower case, start with a letter or number, have no slashes or dots, and be less than 128 characters.
trans-unit.target: The index name must be lower case, start with a letter or number, have no slashes or dots, and be less than 128 characters.

trans-unit.source: After starting the index name with a letter or number, the rest of the name can include any letter, number and dashes, as long as the dashes are not consecutive.
trans-unit.target: After starting the index name with a letter or number, the rest of the name can include any letter, number and dashes, as long as the dashes are not consecutive.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>api-version</languageKeyword> parameter is required.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>api-version</languageKeyword> parameter is required.

trans-unit.source: The current version is <codeInline>api-version=2015-02-28</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The current version is <codeInline>api-version=2015-02-28</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versions of the Azure Search Service REST API</link> for details, including information about alternative versions.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versions of the Azure Search Service REST API</link> for details, including information about alternative versions.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8f35915a-2bfa-4f23-80c3-e3f54e9e4543" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Language support (Azure Search REST API)</link> for details about language analyzers.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8f35915a-2bfa-4f23-80c3-e3f54e9e4543" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Language support (Azure Search REST API)</link> for details about language analyzers.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Set this to <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: Set this to <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.

trans-unit.source: It is a string value, unique to your service.
trans-unit.target: It is a string value, unique to your service.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Create Index</languageKeyword> request must include an <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Create Index</languageKeyword> request must include an <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).

trans-unit.source: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.
trans-unit.target: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.

trans-unit.source: You can get both the service name and <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> from your service dashboard in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get both the service name and <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> from your service dashboard in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> for page navigation help.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> for page navigation help.

trans-unit.source: Request Body Syntax
trans-unit.target: Request Body Syntax

trans-unit.source: The body of the request contains a schema definition, which includes the list of data fields within documents that will be fed into this index.
trans-unit.target: The body of the request contains a schema definition, which includes the list of data fields within documents that will be fed into this index.

trans-unit.source: Note that for a POST request, you must specify the index name in the request body.
trans-unit.target: Note that for a POST request, you must specify the index name in the request body.

trans-unit.source: There can only be one <languageKeyword>key</languageKeyword> field in the index.
trans-unit.target: There can only be one <languageKeyword>key</languageKeyword> field in the index.

trans-unit.source: It has to be a string field.
trans-unit.target: It has to be a string field.

trans-unit.source: This field represents the unique identifier for each document stored with the index.
trans-unit.target: This field represents the unique identifier for each document stored with the index.

trans-unit.source: The main parts of an index include the following:
trans-unit.target: The main parts of an index include the following:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>fields</languageKeyword> that will be fed into this index, including name, data type, and properties that define allowable actions on that field.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>fields</languageKeyword> that will be fed into this index, including name, data type, and properties that define allowable actions on that field.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword> used for auto-complete or type-ahead queries.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>suggesters</languageKeyword> used for auto-complete or type-ahead queries.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>scoringProfiles</languageKeyword> used for custom search score ranking.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>scoringProfiles</languageKeyword> used for custom search score ranking.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="719b924e-6d8a-43c1-b7b0-827487020e3a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add scoring profiles to a search index (Azure Search API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="719b924e-6d8a-43c1-b7b0-827487020e3a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add scoring profiles to a search index (Azure Search API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>defaultScoringProfile</languageKeyword> used to overwrite the default scoring behaviors.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>defaultScoringProfile</languageKeyword> used to overwrite the default scoring behaviors.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>corsOptions</languageKeyword> to allow cross-origin queries against your index.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>corsOptions</languageKeyword> to allow cross-origin queries against your index.

trans-unit.source: The syntax for structuring the request payload is as follows.
trans-unit.target: The syntax for structuring the request payload is as follows.

trans-unit.source: A sample request is provided further on in this topic.
trans-unit.target: A sample request is provided further on in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Index Attributes
trans-unit.target: Index Attributes

trans-unit.source: The following attributes can be set when creating an index.
trans-unit.target: The following attributes can be set when creating an index.

trans-unit.source: Attribute
trans-unit.target: Attribute

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Sets the name of the field.
trans-unit.target: Sets the name of the field.

trans-unit.source: Sets the data type for the field.
trans-unit.target: Sets the data type for the field.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="cc08c9f9-2aff-420f-b01a-bbde2e051c08" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Supported data types (Azure Search)</link> for a list of supported types.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="cc08c9f9-2aff-420f-b01a-bbde2e051c08" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Supported data types (Azure Search)</link> for a list of supported types.

trans-unit.source: Marks the field as full-text search-able.
trans-unit.target: Marks the field as full-text search-able.

trans-unit.source: This means it will undergo analysis such as word-breaking during indexing.
trans-unit.target: This means it will undergo analysis such as word-breaking during indexing.

trans-unit.source: If you set a searchable field to a value like "sunny day", internally it will be split into the individual tokens "sunny" and "day".
trans-unit.target: If you set a searchable field to a value like "sunny day", internally it will be split into the individual tokens "sunny" and "day".

trans-unit.source: This enables full-text searches for these terms.
trans-unit.target: This enables full-text searches for these terms.

trans-unit.source: Fields of type <codeInline>Edm.String</codeInline> or <codeInline>Collection(Edm.String)</codeInline> are <languageKeyword>searchable</languageKeyword> by default.
trans-unit.target: Fields of type <codeInline>Edm.String</codeInline> or <codeInline>Collection(Edm.String)</codeInline> are <languageKeyword>searchable</languageKeyword> by default.

trans-unit.source: Fields of other types are not <languageKeyword>searchable</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: Fields of other types are not <languageKeyword>searchable</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>searchable</languageKeyword> fields consume extra space in your index since Azure Search will store an additional tokenized version of the field value for full-text searches.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>searchable</languageKeyword> fields consume extra space in your index since Azure Search will store an additional tokenized version of the field value for full-text searches.

trans-unit.source: If you want to save space in your index and you don't need a field to be included in searches, set <languageKeyword>searchable</languageKeyword> to <codeInline>false</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: If you want to save space in your index and you don't need a field to be included in searches, set <languageKeyword>searchable</languageKeyword> to <codeInline>false</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Allows the field to be referenced in <languageKeyword>$filter</languageKeyword> queries.
trans-unit.target: Allows the field to be referenced in <languageKeyword>$filter</languageKeyword> queries.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>filterable</languageKeyword> differs from searchable in how strings are handled.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>filterable</languageKeyword> differs from searchable in how strings are handled.

trans-unit.source: Fields of type <codeInline>Edm.String</codeInline> or <codeInline>Collection(Edm.String)</codeInline> that are <languageKeyword>filterable</languageKeyword> do not undergo word-breaking, so comparisons are for exact matches only.
trans-unit.target: Fields of type <codeInline>Edm.String</codeInline> or <codeInline>Collection(Edm.String)</codeInline> that are <languageKeyword>filterable</languageKeyword> do not undergo word-breaking, so comparisons are for exact matches only.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you set such a field f to "sunny day", <codeInline>$filter=f eq 'sunny'</codeInline> will find no matches, but <codeInline>$filter=f eq 'sunny day'</codeInline> will.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you set such a field f to "sunny day", <codeInline>$filter=f eq 'sunny'</codeInline> will find no matches, but <codeInline>$filter=f eq 'sunny day'</codeInline> will.

trans-unit.source: All fields are <languageKeyword>filterable</languageKeyword> by default.
trans-unit.target: All fields are <languageKeyword>filterable</languageKeyword> by default.

trans-unit.source: By default the system sorts results by score, but in many experiences users will want to sort by fields in the documents.
trans-unit.target: By default the system sorts results by score, but in many experiences users will want to sort by fields in the documents.

trans-unit.source: Fields of type <codeInline>Collection(Edm.String)</codeInline> cannot be <languageKeyword>sortable</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: Fields of type <codeInline>Collection(Edm.String)</codeInline> cannot be <languageKeyword>sortable</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: All other fields are <languageKeyword>sortable</languageKeyword> by default.
trans-unit.target: All other fields are <languageKeyword>sortable</languageKeyword> by default.

trans-unit.source: Typically used in a presentation of search results that includes hit count by category (e.g. search for digital cameras and see hits by brand, by megapixels, by price, etc.).
trans-unit.target: Typically used in a presentation of search results that includes hit count by category (e.g. search for digital cameras and see hits by brand, by megapixels, by price, etc.).

trans-unit.source: This option cannot be used with fields of type <codeInline>Edm.GeographyPoint</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: This option cannot be used with fields of type <codeInline>Edm.GeographyPoint</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: All other fields are <languageKeyword>facetable</languageKeyword> by default.
trans-unit.target: All other fields are <languageKeyword>facetable</languageKeyword> by default.

trans-unit.source: Fields of type <codeInline>Edm.String</codeInline> that are <languageKeyword>filterable</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>sortable</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>facetable</languageKeyword> can be at most 32 kilobytes in length.
trans-unit.target: Fields of type <codeInline>Edm.String</codeInline> that are <languageKeyword>filterable</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>sortable</languageKeyword>, or <languageKeyword>facetable</languageKeyword> can be at most 32 kilobytes in length.

trans-unit.source: This is because such fields are treated as a single search term, and the maximum length of a term in Azure Search is 32K kilobytes.
trans-unit.target: This is because such fields are treated as a single search term, and the maximum length of a term in Azure Search is 32K kilobytes.

trans-unit.source: If you need to store more text than this in a single string field, you will need to explicitly set <languageKeyword>filterable</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>sortable</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>facetable</languageKeyword> to <codeInline>false</codeInline> in your index definition.
trans-unit.target: If you need to store more text than this in a single string field, you will need to explicitly set <languageKeyword>filterable</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>sortable</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>facetable</languageKeyword> to <codeInline>false</codeInline> in your index definition.

trans-unit.source: If a field has none of the above attributes set to <codeInline>true</codeInline> (searchable, filterable, sortable, facetable) the field is effectively excluded from the inverted index.
trans-unit.target: If a field has none of the above attributes set to <codeInline>true</codeInline> (searchable, filterable, sortable, facetable) the field is effectively excluded from the inverted index.

trans-unit.source: This option is useful for fields that are not used in queries, but are needed in search results.
trans-unit.target: This option is useful for fields that are not used in queries, but are needed in search results.

trans-unit.source: Excluding such fields from the index improves performance.
trans-unit.target: Excluding such fields from the index improves performance.

trans-unit.source: Previous versions of the API included a <languageKeyword>suggestions</languageKeyword> property.
trans-unit.target: Previous versions of the API included a <languageKeyword>suggestions</languageKeyword> property.

trans-unit.source: This boolean property is now discontinued.
trans-unit.target: This boolean property is now discontinued.

trans-unit.source: Please use the Suggesters API instead.
trans-unit.target: Please use the Suggesters API instead.

trans-unit.source: In the preview version, the <languageKeyword>suggestions</languageKeyword> property was used to specify whether the field could be used for auto-complete for type ahead, for fields of type <codeInline>Edm.String</codeInline> or <codeInline>Collection(Edm.String)</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: In the preview version, the <languageKeyword>suggestions</languageKeyword> property was used to specify whether the field could be used for auto-complete for type ahead, for fields of type <codeInline>Edm.String</codeInline> or <codeInline>Collection(Edm.String)</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Marks the field as containing unique identifiers for documents within the index.
trans-unit.target: Marks the field as containing unique identifiers for documents within the index.

trans-unit.source: Exactly one field must be chosen as the key field and it must be of type <codeInline>Edm.String</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Exactly one field must be chosen as the key field and it must be of type <codeInline>Edm.String</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Key fields can be used to look up documents directly.
trans-unit.target: Key fields can be used to look up documents directly.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="74a67156-c579-4b5f-8f61-3c2e8b83070c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Lookup a document in a search index (Azure Search)</link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="74a67156-c579-4b5f-8f61-3c2e8b83070c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Lookup a document in a search index (Azure Search)</link> for details.

trans-unit.source: Sets whether the field can be returned in a search result.
trans-unit.target: Sets whether the field can be returned in a search result.

trans-unit.source: This is useful when you want to use a field (e.g., margin) as a filter, sorting, or scoring mechanism but do not want the field to be visible to the end user.
trans-unit.target: This is useful when you want to use a field (e.g., margin) as a filter, sorting, or scoring mechanism but do not want the field to be visible to the end user.

trans-unit.source: This attribute must be <codeInline>true</codeInline> for <codeInline>key</codeInline> fields.
trans-unit.target: This attribute must be <codeInline>true</codeInline> for <codeInline>key</codeInline> fields.

trans-unit.source: Sets the name of the language analyzer to use for the field.
trans-unit.target: Sets the name of the language analyzer to use for the field.

trans-unit.source: For the allowed set of values see <link xlink:href="8f35915a-2bfa-4f23-80c3-e3f54e9e4543" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Language support (Azure Search REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: For the allowed set of values see <link xlink:href="8f35915a-2bfa-4f23-80c3-e3f54e9e4543" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Language support (Azure Search REST API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: This option can be used only with <languageKeyword>searchable</languageKeyword> fields.
trans-unit.target: This option can be used only with <languageKeyword>searchable</languageKeyword> fields.

trans-unit.source: Once the analyzer is chosen, it cannot be changed for the field.
trans-unit.target: Once the analyzer is chosen, it cannot be changed for the field.

trans-unit.source: Suggesters
trans-unit.target: Suggesters

trans-unit.source: A <codeInline>suggester</codeInline> defines which fields in an index are used to support auto-complete in searches.
trans-unit.target: A <codeInline>suggester</codeInline> defines which fields in an index are used to support auto-complete in searches.

trans-unit.source: Typically partial search strings are sent to the <link xlink:href="b3fed159-774d-42e0-8ded-ee453f6cd857" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Suggestions (Azure Search Service REST API)</link> while the user is typing a search query, and the API returns a set of suggested phrases.
trans-unit.target: Typically partial search strings are sent to the <link xlink:href="b3fed159-774d-42e0-8ded-ee453f6cd857" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Suggestions (Azure Search Service REST API)</link> while the user is typing a search query, and the API returns a set of suggested phrases.

trans-unit.source: A <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> that you define in the index determines which fields are used to build the type-ahead search term.
trans-unit.target: A <languageKeyword>suggester</languageKeyword> that you define in the index determines which fields are used to build the type-ahead search term.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="1dbc2c8d-5dfb-4662-bf5c-acd289848985" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Suggesters</link> for configuration details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="1dbc2c8d-5dfb-4662-bf5c-acd289848985" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Suggesters</link> for configuration details.

trans-unit.source: Scoring Profiles
trans-unit.target: Scoring Profiles

trans-unit.source: A scoring profile defines custom scoring behaviors that let you influence which items appear higher in the search results.
trans-unit.target: A scoring profile defines custom scoring behaviors that let you influence which items appear higher in the search results.

trans-unit.source: Scoring profiles are made up of field weights and functions.
trans-unit.target: Scoring profiles are made up of field weights and functions.

trans-unit.source: To use them, you specify a profile by name on the query string.
trans-unit.target: To use them, you specify a profile by name on the query string.

trans-unit.source: A default scoring profile operates behind the scenes to compute a search score for every item in a result set.
trans-unit.target: A default scoring profile operates behind the scenes to compute a search score for every item in a result set.

trans-unit.source: You can use the internal, unnamed scoring profile.
trans-unit.target: You can use the internal, unnamed scoring profile.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, set <languageKeyword>defaultScoringProfile</languageKeyword> to use a custom profile as the default, invoked whenever a custom profile is not specified on the query string.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, set <languageKeyword>defaultScoringProfile</languageKeyword> to use a custom profile as the default, invoked whenever a custom profile is not specified on the query string.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="719b924e-6d8a-43c1-b7b0-827487020e3a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add scoring profiles to a search index (Azure Search API)</link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="719b924e-6d8a-43c1-b7b0-827487020e3a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add scoring profiles to a search index (Azure Search API)</link> for details.

trans-unit.source: CORS Options
trans-unit.target: CORS Options

trans-unit.source: Client-side JavaScript cannot call any APIs by default since the browser will prevent all cross-origin requests.
trans-unit.target: Client-side JavaScript cannot call any APIs by default since the browser will prevent all cross-origin requests.

trans-unit.source: To allow cross-origin queries to your index, enable CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) by setting the <languageKeyword>corsOptions</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: To allow cross-origin queries to your index, enable CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) by setting the <languageKeyword>corsOptions</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: Note that for security reasons, only query APIs support CORS.
trans-unit.target: Note that for security reasons, only query APIs support CORS.

trans-unit.source: The following options can be set for CORS:
trans-unit.target: The following options can be set for CORS:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>allowedOrigins</languageKeyword> (required):
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>allowedOrigins</languageKeyword> (required):

trans-unit.source: This is a list of origins that will be granted access to your index.
trans-unit.target: This is a list of origins that will be granted access to your index.

trans-unit.source: This means that any JavaScript code served from those origins will be allowed to query your index (assuming it provides the correct <codeInline>api-key</codeInline>).
trans-unit.target: This means that any JavaScript code served from those origins will be allowed to query your index (assuming it provides the correct <codeInline>api-key</codeInline>).

trans-unit.source: Each origin is typically of the form protocol://<fully-qualified-domain-name>:<port> although the <port> is often omitted.
trans-unit.target: Each origin is typically of the form protocol://<fully-qualified-domain-name>:<port> although the <port> is often omitted.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Cross-origin resource sharing (Wikipedia)</linkText><linkUri>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-origin_resource_sharing</linkUri></externalLink> for more details.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Cross-origin resource sharing (Wikipedia)</linkText><linkUri>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-origin_resource_sharing</linkUri></externalLink> for more details.

trans-unit.source: If you want to allow access to all origins, include * as a single item in the <languageKeyword>allowedOrigins</languageKeyword> array.
trans-unit.target: If you want to allow access to all origins, include * as a single item in the <languageKeyword>allowedOrigins</languageKeyword> array.

trans-unit.source: Note that <embeddedLabel>this is not recommended practice for production search services</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Note that <embeddedLabel>this is not recommended practice for production search services</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: However, it may be useful for development or debugging purposes.
trans-unit.target: However, it may be useful for development or debugging purposes.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>maxAgeInSeconds</languageKeyword> (optional):
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>maxAgeInSeconds</languageKeyword> (optional):

trans-unit.source: Browsers use this value to determine the duration (in seconds) to cache CORS preflight responses.
trans-unit.target: Browsers use this value to determine the duration (in seconds) to cache CORS preflight responses.

trans-unit.source: This must be a non-negative integer.
trans-unit.target: This must be a non-negative integer.

trans-unit.source: The larger this value is, the better performance will be, but the longer it will take for CORS policy changes to take effect.
trans-unit.target: The larger this value is, the better performance will be, but the longer it will take for CORS policy changes to take effect.

trans-unit.source: If it is not set, a default duration of 5 minutes will be used.
trans-unit.target: If it is not set, a default duration of 5 minutes will be used.

trans-unit.source: Request Body Example
trans-unit.target: Request Body Example

trans-unit.source: You can have up to 1000 fields in each index.
trans-unit.target: You can have up to 1000 fields in each index.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="a8b1e21e-7703-4718-8e29-c8825354b3ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Limits and constraints (Azure Search API)</link> and <link xlink:href="36a5b042-285b-46d1-8065-9558e328967c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming Rules (Azure Search)</link> for information about maximum limits and allowable characters.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="a8b1e21e-7703-4718-8e29-c8825354b3ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Limits and constraints (Azure Search API)</link> and <link xlink:href="36a5b042-285b-46d1-8065-9558e328967c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming Rules (Azure Search)</link> for information about maximum limits and allowable characters.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: For a successful request, you should see status code "201 Created".
trans-unit.target: For a successful request, you should see status code "201 Created".

trans-unit.source: By default, the response body will contain the JSON for the index definition that was created.
trans-unit.target: By default, the response body will contain the JSON for the index definition that was created.

trans-unit.source: However, if the Prefer request header is set to return=minimal, the response body will be empty, and the success status code will be "204 No Content" instead of "201 Created".
trans-unit.target: However, if the Prefer request header is set to return=minimal, the response body will be empty, and the success status code will be "204 No Content" instead of "201 Created".

trans-unit.source: This is true regardless of whether PUT or POST is used to create the index.
trans-unit.target: This is true regardless of whether PUT or POST is used to create the index.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Currently, there is limited support for index schema updates.
trans-unit.target: Currently, there is limited support for index schema updates.

trans-unit.source: Any schema updates that would require re-indexing such as changing field types are not currently supported.
trans-unit.target: Any schema updates that would require re-indexing such as changing field types are not currently supported.

trans-unit.source: Although existing fields cannot be changed or deleted, new fields can be added to an existing index at any time.
trans-unit.target: Although existing fields cannot be changed or deleted, new fields can be added to an existing index at any time.

trans-unit.source: When a new field is added, all existing documents in the index will automatically have a null value for that field.
trans-unit.target: When a new field is added, all existing documents in the index will automatically have a null value for that field.

trans-unit.source: No additional storage space will be consumed until new documents are added to the index.
trans-unit.target: No additional storage space will be consumed until new documents are added to the index.

trans-unit.source: Azure Search .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Azure Search .NET SDK
